lead_paragraph: EASTON-LEAF--Eva Lois, born October 30, 1953 in Rochester, New York, died March 31, 2016 in Santa Monica, California. Fierce advocate of the truth. Believer in lost causes, champion of every fight she took on. The smartest and bravest person we all knew. She always insisted on doing the right thing for the right reason, regardless of the personal cost. Much more than "my better half," she was and will remain my moral compass. Her great hero Senator Robert F. Kennedy set her course in life: "I dream of things that never were and ask, 'why not?' "Or, to slightly edit her musical hero, "God only knows what we'll be without her." Rest in peace, pumpkin. I love you the most. David 1/3
